甩.definition: to throw; to fling; to swing; to leave behind; to throw off; to dump (sb)

甩上.definition: to slam (a door); to fling up; to splash up

甩乾.definition: to remove excess moisture by spinning; to put (clothes) through the spin cycle; to spin-dry

甩動.definition: to shake; to fling one's arm; to lash; to swing

甩包袱.definition: lit. to fling off a bundle; fig. to abandon one's responsibility for sth; to wash one's hands of the matter

甩手.definition: to swing one's arms; to wash one's hands of sth

甩手掌櫃.definition: lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper; fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself

甩手頓腳.definition: to fling one's arms and stamp one's feet (in anger or despair)

甩掉.definition: to throw off; to abandon; to cast off; to get rid of; to dump

甩臉子.definition: to grimace with displeasure; to pull a long face

甩賣.definition: to mark down (the price of goods); to sell off cheap

甩車.definition: to uncouple (wagons or trucks from a train)

甩遠.definition: to cast far from oneself; to leave sb far behind; to outdistance

甩鍋.definition: (neologism c. 2017) to shift the blame; to pass the buck

甩開.definition: to shake off; to get rid of

甩開膀子.definition: to throw off inhibitions; to go all out
